page.title: 09PIG FARM, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: In {East Barkwith}there is a small- holding of about 3 acres which specialises in rearing{pigs.}They have 30 sows in the sow-house. Ten sows at a time go into the farrowing house, where they have the piglets. There are heaters in here, which attract the piglets so they don't get squashed by the sow. The piglets have to be injected with iron, and have their teeth clipped so they don't tear the sow's teats. After 3 weeks the piglets are moved to a weaning pool, 30 or 40 piglets in each one. Later they are moved to the fattening house until they are about 6 months old, when they are killed for bacon. They have carefully measured feeds to produce lean meat. Sows produce 4 or 5 litters, of about 12 piglets each, they are then sold for sausages. There are two boars to serve the sows.
